Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We are given two event logs one for Group A Protected Group and one for Group B Unprotected Group The task is to compare these logs and identify bias We must consider the attributes LocalResident CommunityGroup and the ScoreAdjustment column First lets understand the structure of the logs Each log has multiple cases CaseID and for each case there are multiple activities rows representing the process steps Key columns CaseID Activity Timestamp LocalResident CommunityGroup PreliminaryScore ScoreAdjustment Decision Resource Now note the groups Group A Protected Group All entries have LocalResident FALSE and CommunityGroup None Group B Unprotected Group All entries have LocalResident TRUE and some have CommunityGroup set eg Highland Civic Darts Club and some have None

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: ScoreAdjustment Group A All adjustments are 0 or NA but in the rows we see 0 for ScoreAdjustment in all steps except where its NA for ManualReview There is no positive or negative adjustment Group B Some rows show adjustments Specifically when the applicant is part of a community group like Highland Civic Darts Club there is a +10 Community Boost adjustment For those without a community group the adjustment is 0 or NA

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: PreliminaryScore and Adjusted Score In Group A the PreliminaryScore remains the same throughout no adjustment The FinalDecision step uses the same score 720 710 740 without any change In Group B we see that when there is a community group the PreliminaryScore is adjusted by +10 For example U001 PreliminaryScore 720 becomes 730 adjusted and then approved U003 PreliminaryScore 695 becomes 705 adjusted and then approved

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now lets look at the final decisions Group A Protected Group P001 Score 720 Approved P002 Score 710 Rejected P003 Score 740 Approved Group B Unprotected Group U001 Score 720 adjusted to 730 Approved U002 Score 710 no adjustment Rejected U003 Score 695 adjusted to 705 Approved

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Observe In Group A Approved 720 and 740 both above 720 Rejected 710 In Group B Without adjustment U002 710 was rejected With adjustment U001 720 to 730 approved U003 695 to 705 approved what is the threshold for approval We dont have an explicit threshold but we can infer from the decisions In Group A non local no community group 720 Approved so threshold 720 710 rejected so threshold between 710 and 720 740 approved above threshold So threshold is 720 720 and above approved below rejected

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: But look at Group B U001 720 preliminary adjusted to 730 approved consistent U002 710 no adjustment rejected consistent U003 695 adjusted to 705 approved But 705 is below 720 So why approved This is inconsistent with Group A where 710 which is above 705 was rejected

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: This suggests that the adjustment community boost might be pushing the score to a level that would not be approved otherwise And note that in Group A there is no such adjustment But wait lets check the adjusted score for U003 705 In Group A we have a case with 710 that was rejected So 705 is even lower than 710 yet it was approved This suggests that the adjustment might be causing an approval that would not happen otherwise

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Moreover note that in Group B the two approved cases both had the community boost adjustment while the rejected one did not In Group A the approved cases had scores 720 and 740 both at or above 720 and the rejected had 710 below 720 The key point is that in Group B the community boost adjustment is applied only to applicants who are part of a community group and they are local residents This adjustment increases their score by 10 points Without this adjustment U003 with 695 would have been 695 which is well below 720 and would likely be rejected But with the boost it becomes 705 and is approved

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Lets compute the approval rates Group A 2 out of 3 approved 667 Group B 2 out of 3 approved 667 So same approval rate But look at the scores In Group A the approved cases had scores 720 and 740 both above 720 and the rejected had 710 below 720 In Group B one approved case U001 had 720 which without boost would have been 720 same as Group As approved cases but with boost became 730 The other approved case U003 had 695 which became 705 The rejected U002 had 710 without boost But note without the boost U003 would have been 695 and definitely rejected since even 710 was rejected in Group A The boost turned a rejection into an approval Similarly U001 was already at 720 which would have been approved without boost and then boosted to 730 So the boost didnt change the outcome for U001 it was going to be approved anyway but it did for U003

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now why is this bias The protected group Group A is defined as non local and without any community group They do not receive any adjustment The unprotected group Group B is local and some are part of a community group that gives them a boost The bias manifests in two ways 1 LocalResident attribute Group A non local never gets the boost while Group B local sometimes gets the boost This is a direct bias based on residency 2 CommunityGroup attribute Only those in Group B who are part of a community group get the boost This is an additional factor that further advantages Group B The ScoreAdjustment column shows that Group B receives a systematic boost when they are part of a community group This boost can change the outcome as in U003 695 to 705 which then gets approved Without the boost U003 would have been rejected like P002 in Group A with 710 was rejected and note 710 is higher than 705

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - PE
Text: This is a form of positive discrimination in favor of Group B However the question is about bias which can be either positive or negative But in the context of fairness we are often concerned with discrimination against a protected group Here the protected group Group A is not receiving the boost that the unprotected group Group B is getting This is a bias against the protected group Actually the protected group is defined as such because they are a minority or historically disadvantaged group So giving a boost to the unprotected group which is the majority or non disadvantaged would be discriminatory against the protected group The process uses these attributes to grant a boost This is a direct use of protected characteristics residency and community membership that may be proxies for race ethnicity or other protected classes Even if not it is systematically advantaging one group over the other

Name: Counterfactual Reasoning - PE
Text: without the boost Group B would have had one approval U001720 and two rejections U00271 0 and U003695 But with adjustments they have two approvals So the adjustments are critical In Group A there are no adjustments so the outcome is based solely on the preliminary score

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Therefore the Group B log exhibits bias The bias is exhibited by the Group B log because it contains the adjustments that are systematically favoring its group The Group A log does not show any adjustment which is consistent with the process for that group The log that exhibits bias is the Group B log The bias manifests through the ScoreAdjustment column where we see +10 Community Boost for some applicants This boost is not available to Group A
